_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Plainville Farms, LLC, a subsidiary of Hain Pure Protein Corporation, is committed to operating all of its facilities in the safest possible condition to protect their employees, the public, and environment receptors located near the plant.  The New Oxford, Pennsylvania Poultry Processing Plant has written this document in an effort prepare for emergencies relating to the anhydrous ammonia, which is currently used as a refrigerant above the EPA threshold value of 10,000 lbs, and to comply with Title 40 of the Code of Federal Regulations Part 68.  This document, in conjunction with the Process Safety Management Program, will be used to comply with the Title 40 regulations.

Plainville Farms, LLC (Plainville Farms) utilizes anhydrous ammonia in the refrigeration system at its New Oxford Processing Facility, located at 304 South Water Street, in New Oxford, Pennsylvania, 17350.  The substance is received by a tanker truck delivery and is transferred into the high-pressure receiver located outside the Air Compressor Room northwest corner of the facility.  The plant has a total capacity of 38,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia and normally stores about 34,000 pounds of the product within its refrigeration system during normal operations.

The facility's Safety Manager maintains an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) and a Chemical Release Emergency Prevention Plan which provides the response procedures all employees, contractors, and visitors to the Plainville Farms New Oxford Processing Facility must follow. As provided in these documents, Plainville Farms New Oxford Processing Facility employees are to inform an incident commander in the event that an ammonia release is suspected.  It is the responsibility of the incident commander to confirm that an ammonia release has occurred and determine the necessary level of evacuation as well as to call the fire department to respond to the incident.  The Plainville Farms New Oxford Processing Facility does not currently have an Incident

Response Team trained to the Hazardous Materials Technician Level of the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) standard 29 CFR 1910.120 - Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER)).  As such, employees are prohibited from acting in an offensive or defensive manner to respond to incidental ammonia releases (as specified by 29 CFR 1910.120).

Plainville Farms New Oxford Processing Facility uses employee/contractor training, standard operating procedures, pre-startup safety reviews, management of change procedures, hot work permit, and auditing programs as the basis for its general release prevention program.  The facility has a preventative maintenance program, a pipe and valve labeling program, and an inspection program related to the anhydrous ammonia refrigeration system.  Plainville Farms New Oxford Processing Facility employees and management continually seek new ways to improve the safety of the system. 

To date, there have been no known accidental ammonia releases from the Plainville Farms New Oxford Processing Facility that have resulted in either an on-site or off-site consequence.
